isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - INSTALL - RIGHT REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If previously removed, thread pipe plug in the rear of the reverse idler shaft and tighten ( Figure 375). Install the idler plate on the shaft, flat side to the front ( inset, Figure 375).

figure.caption: Figure 374. Thread Pipe Plug in Rear of Reverse Idler Shaft and Install Idler Plate

step1.para: If previously removed, press the needle bearing into the bore of the reverse idler gear ( Figure 376).

figure.caption: Figure 375. Press Needle Bearing into Bore of Reverse Idler Gear

step1.para: Install the bearing inner race on the idler shaft and insert shaft into the case bore, threaded end of shaft to the front. As the idler shaft is moved forward, install the reverse idler gear on the shaft, long hub to the front and seating on the bearing inner race. Position the thrust washer on the shaft between the gear and support boss in the case and continue with movement of the idler shaft forward into the bore of the support boss ( Figure 377).

Making sure that the reverse idler shaft is seated in the bore of support boss and forward as far as possible, install the washer and stop nut on the front of the shaft ( Figure 378). Tighten nut to 50 to 60 ft-lbs. (68 to 81 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 377. Install Washer and Stop Nut on Front of Shaft

step1.para: Install the OUTER RACE of auxiliary countershaft front bearing into the case bore and against the idler plate ( Figure 379).

figure.caption: Figure 378. Install Outer Race of Auxiliary Countershaft Front Bearing

important.para: Mark the countershaft drive gear for timing purposes. On the drive gear of each countershaft assembly, mark the tooth aligned with the keyway of the gear and stamped with an "O" for easy identification ( Figure 380). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.

figure.caption: Figure 379. Mark Countershaft Drive Gear For Timing Purposes
